title: Stephen Miller Offers a Strongman’s View of the World
summary: President Trump’s trusted adviser is casting his hard-right gaze abroad, saying the world must be governed by “force.”

title: Russia Sends Naval Vessel to Escort Oil Tanker U.S. Is Pursuing
summary: The development deepens the confrontation over the tanker formerly known as the Bella 1, which the United States wants to seize but which Russia has sought to protect.

title: After Trump’s Military Victory in Venezuela, Cuba’s Economy Is in ‘Freefall’
summary: With widespread power outages, medicine shortages and rising food prices, experts say Cuba’s economy has never been worse, with the crisis coming just as the supply of Venezuelan oil is threatened.

title: Trump Claims Venezuela Will Hand Over Oil, and L.A. Wildfires Leave Behind Toxic Homes
summary: Plus, a journey to a melting continent.

title: Fed’s Independence Faces Critical Tests as Trump Seeks to Remake Institution
summary: The central bank faces two major hurdles early on in 2026 that will determine the extent to which it operates free of political meddling.

title: FEMA Staff Bracing for Dismissal of 1,000 Disaster Workers
summary: The job cuts expected this month are part of a plan by the Homeland Security secretary, Kristi Noem, to remake the agency.

title: Béla Fleck Withdraws From Kennedy Center Concerts
summary: “Performing there has become charged and political,” the 18-time Grammy winner said.

title: Europe Tries to Come to Terms With Trump’s Intervention in Venezuela
summary: Needing U.S. support to fend off Russia in Ukraine, European leaders have been cautious about criticizing President Trump on Greenland, Iran, Venezuela and much else.

title: European Allies Agree to Key Security Provisions for Ukraine
summary: Britain and France firmed up a postwar troop commitment in Ukraine, though Russia has said it will reject any deal that allows NATO-country forces in Ukraine.

title: China’s Threat to Block Rare Earths Has Put Japan on High Alert
summary: Tokyo is concerned at signs that Beijing may be laying the groundwork to restrict access to the metals vital to manufacturing.

title: China Touts Hainan, Its Duty-Free Island, Amid $1 Trillion Trade Surplus
summary: Policies meant to lure importers to Hainan, a resort island off China’s coast, signal an opening up, Beijing says. One expert calls it a “bait and switch.”

title: Should Staten Island and the East Village Share a House District?
summary: A court dispute over the lines of the 11th Congressional District represents one of New York Democrats’ few hopes of drawing maps in their favor for the 2026 midterms.

title: N.Y.C. Child Care Programs Brace for Cuts After Federal Funding Freeze
summary: The Trump administration said it was placing a hold on $10 billion in subsidies across five states, including New York.

title: Despite Little Research, Companies Race to Market Autism Tests
summary: Backers claim the tests can predict a child’s risk of autism using a strand of hair or a mother’s blood, but critics say they are not ready for the market.

title: Aldrich Ames, C.I.A. Turncoat Who Helped the Soviets, Dies at 84
summary: As chief of the counterintelligence branch of the C.I.A.’s Soviet division, he had access to some of the nation’s deepest secrets. He had been serving a life sentence since 1994.

title: Suspect in Brown and M.I.T. Killings Discussed Attacks in Videos, Officials Say
summary: Claudio Neves Valente, who is accused of killing two students at Brown and an M.I.T. professor, left rambling descriptions of the shootings.

title: The Cast and Creators of ‘KPop Demon Hunters’ on How the Movie Came to Be
summary: As the filmmakers, songwriters and actors tell it, their “wackadoo” concept evolved over nine years and eight versions of “Golden” into a global phenomenon.

title: A Defense of U.S. Intervention in Venezuela
summary: The former envoy Elliott Abrams says the administration should push harder for regime change.

title: My Long Weekend With 700 People Touched by Death
summary: Facing death is a core part of making meaning of one’s life. To struggle through this universal contemplation without a community can be brutal.

title: The Law of the Jungle
summary: We ask where America’s new foreign policy might take us — and the world.

title: Ronny Chieng Remarks on Trump ‘DoorDash-ing’ Maduro to Brooklyn
summary: “The Daily Show” host quipped that after a surprise capture, Nicolás Maduro “will face justice in the best legal system in the world that we illegally kidnapped him to.”

title: What to Know About the Vaccines Cut From C.D.C. Recommendations
summary: Federal health officials upended the immunization schedule for American children this week. These are the diseases affected.

title: Michael Reagan, a Son of President Reagan Who Fought for Right-Wing Causes, Dies at 80
summary: Mr. Reagan, who was the son of Ronald Reagan and his first wife, Jane Wyman, built on his father’s conservative legacy with a radio talk show and columns on right-wing sites like Newsmax.

title: Court Questions Trump Administration Effort to End Temporary Protected Status for Haitians
summary: A federal judge questioned whether the Trump administration appropriately reviewed safety conditions in Haiti before ending protections for people from the Caribbean nation.

title: Michigan City to Pay $3.25 Million After Woman Was Mistakenly Declared Dead
summary: Timesha Beauchamp, 20, was found alive at a funeral home after she had been pronounced dead during a medical episode in Southfield, Mich. She died weeks later.
